title: Video shows home explode after hurricane evacuation
description: A New Jersey home exploded hours after its residents evacuated due to rising floodwaters from Hurricane Ida. CNN affiliate WABC has the details.

title: Doctor reacts to Trump's booster comments
description: Dr. Jonathan Reiner reacts to President Donald Trump telling the Wall Street Journal that he "probably won't" get a Covid-19 vaccine booster.

title: Three-time Super Bowl champion David Patten dies in motorcycle crash at age 47
description: David Patten, who helped the New England Patriots clinch three Super Bowls between 2001 and 2004, died Thursday, according to a statement from the Patriots.

title: Passenger accused of punching Southwest flight attendant faces federal charges
description: The passenger accused of punching a Southwest Airlines flight attendant and breaking three of her teeth on a May flight now faces federal felony charges.

title: How Texas' abortion law stacks up globally
Biden orders a declassification review of documents related to September 11 attacks
description: President Joe Biden on Friday signed an executive order directing the Department of Justice and other federal agencies to conduct a declassification review related to the FBI's investigation of the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.

title: Rocket built by startup Firefly explodes off California coast
description: A 100-foot-tall rocket burst into flames mid-air after launching from California Thursday evening, dashing the hopes of a Texas-based startup to put a rocket into Earth's orbit on its first-ever launch attempt.

title: Congresswoman makes a personal revelation to fight Texas abortion ban
description: Rep. Pramila Jayapal (D-WA) talks with CNN about her opposition to Texas' restrictive abortion ban.

title: What is the Texas abortion ban and why does it matter?
description: On January 22, 1973, the US Supreme Court made the landmark decision that guaranteed women their right to terminate a pregnancy before viability, usually around the 24-week mark. The case that set the precedent, Roe v. Wade, based on a challenge to Texas laws, enshrined into law the rights of all women to an abortion.

title: This actress made Emmy history. Hear her message
description: CNN's Larry Madowo speaks with Mj Rodriguez, the first out trans woman nominated for the lead actress Emmy award.

title: California's firefighters are exhausted -- and this wildfire season isn't close to being over
description: Firefighters battling a devastating wildfire season in California are exhausted as they face the state's massive Caldor Fire that has been threatening a popular tourist city for days -- and the likelihood of more fires in the weeks ahead.

title: 'There is a big problem here': CNN fact-checks Biden's claim
description: CNN's Daniel Dale fact-checks a claim by President Biden that he visited the Tree of Life Synagogue in Pittsburgh after a mass shooting there left 11 people dead in 2018.

title: Former district attorney indicted in connection to Ahmaud Arbery investigation
description: A former district attorney in Georgia has been charged after allegedly interfering with the arrest of a man involved in the 2020 shooting death of 25-year-old Ahmaud Arbery.

title: Bowie's 'Starman' and other out-of-this-world songs for a spacewalk
description: Countdown to the next spacewalk: On Friday, September 3, Russian cosmonauts Oleg Novitskiy and Pyotr Dubrov will stretch their legs on a nearly 7-hour spacewalk outside the International Space Station.

title: Apple walks back plans for new child safety tools after privacy backlash
description: Apple on Friday reversed course on its plans to implement new features aimed at combating child exploitation and promoting safety following backlash over the technology's potential implications for privacy.

title: More than 800 people were crowded into a temporary hurricane shelter. Four of them died
Children's show throws shade at Kanye West over album rating
description: HLN's Melissa Knowles reports on the children's series Peppa Pig's now since-deleted Tweet poking fun at Kanye West after they earned a higher album rating than his new "Donda" album.

title: England's players allegedly racially abused by Hungary fans during World Cup qualifier, according to FA
description: Some of England's players were reportedly racially abused by Hungary fans during the team's 4-0 World Cup qualifying win over Hungary.

title: Alaska Airlines introduces $200 bonus for vaccinated staff
description: Alaska Airlines is handing out a $200 incentive to employees who can prove that they've been fully vaccinated against Covid-19.

title: ISIS supporter shot dead by New Zealand police after shoppers stabbed in 'terrorist attack'
description: New Zealand police have shot and killed a man who injured multiple people in a supermarket in the Auckland suburb of New Lynn, police say.

title: Three doses of Covid-19 vaccine are likely needed for full protection, Fauci says
Defrocked Cardinal Theodore McCarrick pleaded not guilty to sexual assault charges
description: Former Cardinal Theodore McCarrick, who was defrocked by The Vatican in 2019 over sex abuse allegations, pleaded not guilty to three counts of indecent assault and battery on a person 14 or older at an arraignment in Dedham District Court in Massachusetts Friday.

title: Women stage protest in Taliban-controlled Kabul
More than 100 Democratic lawmakers introduce legislation to lower Medicare eligibility age to 60
description: More than 100 Democratic lawmakers in the House from all wings of the caucus introduced legislation on Friday to lower the Medicare eligibility age to 60.

title: Heavy clashes erupt between Taliban and anti-Taliban group
description: Fighting in Afghanistan's last major holdout against Taliban rule continued through Friday after heavy clashes erupted overnight between Taliban fighters and an anti-Taliban group, according to Taliban sources.

title: Biden's leadership under extreme examination
The celebrity photographer who refuses to Photoshop movie icons
description: Celebrity photographer Andy Gotts has snapped numerous stars, from Hollywood titans Al Pacino, Brad Pitt and Julia Roberts to promising newcomers like Anya Taylor-Joy and Nathalie Emmanuel. But one picture stands out to him as the most poignant of his career: a portrait of the late Tony Curtis, his face painted with an American flag.

title: Qatar plays key role in dealing with Taliban. Hear from a top official whether they trust them
description: CNN's Isa Soares asks Qatari Assistant Foreign Minister Lolwah Al-Khater whether Qatar, which is a key player in dealing with the Taliban, can trust the militant group.

title: John Kerry is pushing China to do more on climate. Beijing is pushing back
description: One question looms above all others in United States climate envoy John Kerry's climate diplomacy agenda: What can the US do about China?

title: Lil Nas X trolls Drake with album 'pregnancy' announcement
description: If there's one thing Lil Nas X knows well, it's how to get a rise out of Drake fans.

title: See rural US town welcoming hundreds of Afghan refugees
description: Fort McCoy, Wisconsin, is the temporary home for up to 13,000 recently evacuated Afghan refugees. CNN's Omar Jimenez visits a nearby town to speak with a former Cuban refugee about his journey and advice for this generation of refugees.

title: Visually impaired sprinter gets engaged on the track just minutes after Paralympics race
description: Keula Nidreia Pereira Semedo did not win gold at the Paralympic Games but the Cape Verde athlete may have received something even better.

title: China will create a stock exchange in Beijing
description: China will set up a new stock exchange in Beijing, giving the nation's capital and political center more influence in the world of business and finance.

title: What is the healthiest fish to eat? The best choices for you and the planet
description: We're all trying to make healthier choices, but when it comes to fish, is one type truly better than another? Nutritionally, there's no wrong choice when it comes to seafood as a food group.

title: The chance of Gov. Gavin Newsom getting recalled is declining in California
description: It's now less than two weeks until California's recall election, and the latest polling suggests good news for Gov. Gavin Newsom. Polls show that an increasing percentage of voters say they're going to vote "no" on the recall.

title: Banksy's shredded painting is on sale again -- and it may be worth six times as much
description: It's been almost three years since a Banksy painting partially shredded itself in front of shocked onlookers, moments after selling for over £1 million ($1.4 million) at a London auction.

title: This new material could measure your heart rate through your shirt
description: A group of researchers has developed a new material they say is as soft as cotton but as strong as Kevlar and as conductive as many metals. It can be worn and washed like normal clothing and could eventually turn athletic apparel into smart "wearables."

title: Texans fear the dire consequences of new laws targeting people of color
description: An abortion fund that helps hundreds of women in the southernmost region of Texas each year has stopped answering its hotline after one of the strictest bans in the nation went into effect this week.

title: 66 matches and 28 years later, Spain loses a FIFA World Cup qualifying match
description: Spain suffered a first World Cup qualifying defeat in 28 years with a 2-1 defeat against Sweden in Stockholm.

title: Golf's man of the moment on the 'life-altering' event that changed him forever
description: There are few golfers more in form than Patrick Cantlay at the moment.

title: Alibaba pledges $15.5 billion to help China achieve 'common prosperity'
description: Alibaba is pouring 100 billion yuan ($15.5 billion) into China's drive to achieve "common prosperity," marking the latest big pledge from a Chinese company to support President Xi Jinping's campaign.

title: The flight attendant using the pandemic to train as a pilot
description: When Jordan Milano Hazrati was offered a job as a flight attendant with Virgin Atlantic, it was a dream come true.

title: The long arm of China's new maritime law risks causing conflict with US and Japan
description: Beijing wants foreign vessels to give notice before entering "Chinese territorial waters," providing maritime authorities with detailed information -- including the ship's name, call sign, current position, next port of call and estimated time of arrival.

title: Chef of world's cheapest Michelin meal loses his star
description: A Singaporean hawker stall known for offering the world's least expensive Michelin-starred meal has just lost its designation.

title: Former nurse pleads guilty to sexual abuse of intellectually disabled woman at long-term care facility
description: A former nurse pleaded guilty Thursday to sexually assaulting an intellectually disabled woman in an Arizona long-term health care facility.

title: Shang-Chi: Marvel's latest superhero looks to rewrite the blockbuster script
description: Destin Daniel Cretton is reflecting on what his younger self would have made of all this. His new movie tells the story of Shang-Chi, the first Asian superhero to lead a Marvel film. A Chinese character living in America, compelled to return. Negotiating two cultures under the weight of expectations, but remaining true to himself above everything. "I could have really used a hero like this," the director says.

title: Not yet satisfied: Talking sex and sexuality in Africa
description: Meet the women breaking long-standing taboos -- and empowering themselves and others -- by starting conversations about pleasure and power. Video producer: Adeyemi Michael; video editor: CNN's Corinne Chin.

title: The world's largest wooden sailing ship has a 200-year-old story
description: Nearly 200 years after it sank into the sea, the galleon Götheborg is retracing its path around the world.

title: She's a huge star, but there's barely a trace of her online. Here's why
description: China is carrying out a sweeping crackdown on a number of industries, including the entertainment business. CNN's Will Ripley takes a look at how the move will impact celebrities and their fans.
